intro: Koilodepas brevipes var. brevipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved koilodepas, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
